Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory121.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aston', 3: 'We meet again, commandant from Babylonia. Thanks to your reckless behavior, this carriage is no longer safe.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'The carriages near the Hetero-Core were not safe from the start.', 3: '6', 4: "We won't leave anyone behind.", 5: '9'}
{2: 'Aston', 3: "That's not true. At least those filthy Corrupted never invaded our carriage.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ashlar', 3: 'Is this how Babylonia works? Always spieling lies like that? Revolting.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Crying Commoner Child', 3: 'Wahhhhh! Momma! Momma! Wahhh! Where are you...'}
{2: 'Angry Aristocrat Woman', 3: 'Shoo! Stop pulling on my dress with your filthy hands! Whose child is this?! Take it away!'}
{2: 'Sobbing Commoner Woman', 3: "My love... I'm sorry... Ahh... Why did I escape alone..."}
{2: 'Agitated Aristocrat Man', 3: "I've had enough of these pesky scums! Why are we not moving forward?! I can't stand being in the same carriage as these filthy mutts for one more second!"}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ashlar', 3: "Tsk, it's too crowded here... Reminds me of why I hate crowds...", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'Which is why I suggested going to Babylonia.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Ashlar', 3: 'You suggested... Wait, Lord Aston, what is the meaning of this?', 4: '2'}
{1: '2', 2: 'Ashlar', 3: 'Aston, you...! Damn you for betraying us aristocrats!', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'I have no intention to betray you. And as Aston said, going to Babylonia can satisfy your aristocratic lifestyle!', 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "But even Babylonia can't accept this number of people in... This deal...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'I never said all, just move in the "selected few." You should have room for that many, right?', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'You mean, only the aristocrats...', 4: '1'}
{1: '2', 2: 'Ashlar', 3: 'Hmph... Looks like you still know the rules.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Commoner', 3: 'What... What are you talking about...'}
{2: 'Commoner', 3: "So we're gonna be abandoned either way?! Dammit!"}
{3: 'The commoners cowering in the corner by the door instantly exploded with rage.'}
{3: 'A wail of sorrow pierces through the rioting crowd, and the source of the wail, a woman in tattered clothing, walks out of the crowd—'}
{3: '—And as if possessed by something unseen, she rushes for the door, tears it open, and scrambles toward the carriages in the back.'}
{2: 'Panicking Commoner', 3: "It's full of Corrupted in the back! Someone stop her..."}
{2: 'Anxious Aristocrat', 3: 'Are you out of your mind?! C-close the door!!'}
{2: 'Resentful Commoner', 3: "Isn't she the one who got separated from her husband..."}
{3: 'The crowd hurries to close the door.'}
{2: 'No, we have to save her!', 3: '53', 4: 'We have to stop her.', 5: '53'}
{2: 'Angry Aristocrat', 3: "Over our dead bodies! You don't have a say on what happens on our train!"}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "But that's a living and breathing person...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rude Commoner', 3: "Cut the crap! You lot are all talk and no work! Always ordering us around! Get outta here if you ain't helping us to improve our livelihoods!"}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Everyone, p-please calm down...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Angry Aristocrat', 3: "You filthy scums! If you want to die, then go die quietly in a corner! Don't waste our oxygen!"}
{3: 'Liv tries to get between the two fighting classes that look like they may go into a war at any second.'}
{3: "That is when a woman's screaming sounds from the other carriage, followed by silence."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "...I'm sorry, Commandant. If only Lucia or Lee is here...", 4: '1'}
{2: "It's not your fault.", 3: '70', 4: 'You already tried your best.', 5: '70'}
{3: 'Sparks were no longer flying and the tension eased into silence due to this sudden incident.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jamilah', 3: '...Everyone, please listen to me.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: "I don't plan to abandon any one of you... It is not my intention for anyone to get hurt.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'After the aristocrats leave, there will only be commoners left on this train. Do you understand the meaning of this?', 4: '3'}
{1: '1000', 2: 'The peasants will be in control of this train.', 3: '79', 4: 'One side of the conflict will leave this train.', 5: '80'}

{2: 'Jamilah', 3: "That's right. This train and the wealth that the aristocrats can't bring with them will all belong to the commoners, which should be enough for commoners to survive and thrive.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'Correct. Both parties will be satisfied then...', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'But that can only happen under the premise that Babylonia accepts our deal.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'If you agree, we can form an alliance and immediately destroy that black thing.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: "But if you decline, then this train, and that horrible thing on it, will be handed over to the Ascendants as per the aristocrats' request.", 4: '3'}
{1: '2000', 2: "That's a gamble, not a deal.", 3: '88', 4: '...Is that your choice?', 5: '89'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'It was a gamble from the start.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'As you can see, the aristocrats have enough power to decide the fate of Akdilek... I can only speak my heart at times of importance.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'This train has been running ever since the outbreak of the virus, and everywhere we pass by has only been a pitstop for us.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'Be it commoners or aristocrats, we all want to reach that terminal station... The final destination where we can call home.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: 'And on this journey in search of peace... Many have paid the price with their sanity, including Ashlar, including me...', 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'But using something this dangerous to bet...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Sophia', 3: "It's not possible. Leader, you've been fighting on till now for the happiness of us all, how can you have gone insane...", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Jamilah', 3: "It's because you've been by my side.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Jamilah', 3: "No matter what, this deal will decide the fate of all on this train, so I have to reach an outcome that I won't regret!", 4: '3'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Commandant, what should we do now...', 4: '1'}
{2: "Now's not the time to fight.", 3: '112', 4: "Let's wait for Lucia and Lee.", 5: '114'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "It's true that I alone can't defeat the enemy. Not to mention that whatever we try to do now is going to be hindered...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I know they will come back. Then we'll be able to find a way!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Please hurry back, Lucia, Lee...', 4: '1'}
